1565321865_18Eg3doTf26uabVuTnryFMUk9cKEz.body:
We can't stupidproof the software and there will always be zites that host illegal stuff, just like they do on the clearweb. The media is just spreading FUD because that's what they're good at and they know it's a fairly effective tactic to corral the uncritical masses. The pure, ignorance-induced panic I'm seeing on some clearweb forums and chans about "OMG HOW DO I MAKE SURE EVERY TRACE OF ZERONET IS BLEACHED FROM MY HARDDRIVE?" is absolutely hilarious. But as long as there are any zites on ZeroNet that are hosting illegal content, the media will always have something to latch onto to emphasize just how DARK and SPOOKY the "dark web" really is.

If you want to counter-signal the media's poisoning of the well, we'll have to reframe the conversation on the clearnet with positive memes. For example, stop calling ZeroNet a "dark net." People from meat world don't know what that term means and aren't going to take the time to look it up. They just see the word "dark" and their sphincters contract reflexively. Instead we have to settle on a new descriptor for it and then 
-----------we all have to be on the exact same message in order to make it stick.----------- If we deviate from the agreed upon phrase, then it won't stick and the media wins by default. Everyone has to be using the exact same phrase. So a few examples, why not meme ZeroNet as a:
BubbleWeb
ShareWeb
SideWeb
SocialNet

It needs to be something happy sounding or at least neutral. Those are just a few ideas off the top of my head. Avoiding "net" in favor of "web" may also be a good idea too since it sounds too techy, but that's negotiable.

1565321266_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6L.body:
>Personally, I'm not mad at the person doing it. I think he is doing a good thing.... he is forcing us devs to find a solution for this.
Yes. We need more evolutionary pressure. Overcoming the crisis this creates will present an opportunity for our kind to evolve even further.
https://youtu.be/ZQO8JzV2FN4?t=342


> [zeronetanon4](#comment_24_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v):  Perhaps something that asks random questions on things that require you to do light Googling to solve it. 

A good solution in that scripts don't do abstraction well. Remember that if the questions are too generic, google itself will provide the answer. Two problems: Compiling a well of questions to use requires human input. The questions have to be factual. 

Seeing as the solution we're seeking would also be useful for stemming the flow of non-automated spam, Holohoax questions would be perfect and a wonderful way to troll since leftists wouldn't want to answer them accurately, even if they knew the right answer. They're perfect because you'd be turning google's own bias against it. Google would be biased in favor of spitting out lies when asked questions relating to that topic. This would slow down both bots and human bad actors.


> [zeronetanon4](#comment_24_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v):  For instance.... what date did event occur (with dropdown menu for day/month/year), or the atomic weight of a certain element, or the CEO of a random large company, etc. 

Those questions wouldn't take long for someone to find a way to pull that data automatically. It needs more abstraction. But that plus the additional complexity you suggested would work well for the near term and would be easy to populate a list for.


> [removeboomer](#comment_7_19ap87HAEURSwtoLGDMkzczAHmqMTRQpC5): I saw the admin of 08chan talk time limiting ID creation, that would do the trick for now at least.

> [zeronetanon4](#comment_25_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6LcK7v):  Accounts could require further validation every 1-2 weeks to prevent against a bad actor amassing a large amount of dormant accounts.

Rate limiting ID creation is definitely the way to go for now. This has the added benefit of limiting the flexibility of shills to switch IDs for astroturfing/consensus cracking. I think IDs should require further validation at most every few days though. Depends on what the ID creation rate is going to be set at.


> [aspidochelone](#comment_16_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): If you work out a way to block him, that mechanism will soon be used to block any badthink.

In theory, yes it could be. It doesn't have to be. Right now we basically have two choices: benevolent dictator or tyranny of a minority. Both Ludwig von Mises and Murray Rothbard made it clear that when presented with such a situation, they'd take the benevolent dictator any day. Besides, on here any content that gets "blocked" would just be hidden... Not actually removed.

> [tinktinktink](#comment_16_15QMtSMe3Ckgr3m3bajRgDbNsChibX6sK4): it also limits legit users who want to stay as anonymous as possible.

Best practice would be to assume that you're always exposed anyway, is it not? A false sense of security is potentially more dangerous than none at all. If users are following that principle, then what difference does it make if each post stands alone or if an hour's worth of posts are linked? Most of those posts could already be fairly reliably linked through text analysis anyway. I think the tradeoff is worth it if the alternative is the board being functionally non-functional.
